name: raggedness
content:
raggedness noun [U]
(BAD QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of not being very good, as a result of not being well organized: Thursday's show was not without some raggedness. Its very sloppiness and raggedness made it very exciting.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was a slight raggedness in the violins. Critics complained about the raggedness of the performance.

raggedness noun [U]
(CLOTHES)
the untidy appearance of clothes that are torn and not in good condition, or of a person wearing them: We were shocked by the raggedness of the children's clothes. Everyone was used to his raggedness.
More examplesFewer examplesI was ashamed of the raggedness of my garments.Of all the beggars that I had seen, he was the chief for raggedness.
